title: Strengthening Hospitality Practical Skills: Evidence-Based Distance Education Program Design for Advanced Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge and applied experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners achieve practical competency in applying advanced mathematical theories to solve real-world work problems.
Learners perform knowledge sharing and feedback processes with peers using LMS collaboration tools at over 80% proficiency.

Applying evidence-based design principles (e.g., ADDIE model, Kirkpatrick evaluation model), learners create a 12-week self-directed learning plan, maintain weekly implementation logs, and submit a final evaluation report. They achieve 3/4 or higher in a faculty advisor’s 4-point scale assessment.
Learners produce visualizations and presentation materials of mathematical analysis results through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
